sourcing.instructions: Erbium (Er): Purchase from a rare earth metals supplier; Indium (In): Available at electronics supply stores; Terbium (Tb): Obtain from specialized chemical suppliers; Thulium (Tm): Sourced from rare earth metal distributors.
steps: Erbium (Er): Purchase from a rare earth metals supplier; Indium (In): Available at electronics supply stores; Terbium (Tb): Obtain from specialized chemical suppliers; Thulium (Tm): Sourced from rare earth metal distributors.

1. Weigh out 24.3 g of Erbium, 16.2 g of Indium, 18.4 g of Terbium, and 8.1 g of Thulium using a precision scale. 2. Combine the materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a ceramic mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous mixture is obtained.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 24.3 g of Erbium, 16.2 g of Indium, 18.4 g of Terbium, and 8.1 g of Thulium using a precision scale. 2. Combine the materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a ceramic mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a homogeneous mixture is obtained.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C at a rate of 5째C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C at a rate of 5째C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature without opening the door. 2. This process may take approximately 8-10 hours to ensure even cooling and to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature without opening the door. 2. This process may take approximately 8-10 hours to ensure even cooling and to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once at room temperature, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish and apply a sealant if necessary to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once at room temperature, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible. 3. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish and apply a sealant if necessary to protect the surface.
